content: Four-legged friends are dressed like Royals to celebrate the King's CoronationREAD MORE: King Charles Coronation LIVE - latest updatesFour-legged friends across the nation have put their best paws forward to mark the Coronation of King Charles and take part in their own Big Lunch.

Patriotic pooches around Britain have donned bandanas, ribbons and even crowns as the country celebrates its new King and Queen. After the grandeur of the Coronation ceremony, the Coronation Big Lunches are taking place in what a palace spokesperson has described as 'a nationwide act of celebration and friendship'.Alongside the thousands of smaller street parties expected to be held at the weekend, people are encouraged to come together across the country for the Coronation Big Lunch.Members of the public and organisers from a number of charities across the UK have expressed their enthusiasm ahead of the event.

From crown-wearing corgis to bulldogs, Brits are going above and beyond to prove their pet is the most patriotic.Here, FEMAIL have rounded up all of the best pictures that will paw-sitively brighten up your Coronation weekend:
